intro: Thoracosperma hirta, commonly known as the hairy tamarind, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces woody pods containing edible seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a food source. It thrives in humid climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
